fields.headline: Spared
fields.bodyText: 'That Love is all there is, Is all we know of Love ....' - Emily Dickinson It wasn't you, it wasn't me, Up there, two thousand feet above The New York street. We're safe, and free, A little while, to live and love, Imagining what might have been - The phone-call from the blazing tower, A last farewell on the machine, While someone sleeps another hour, Or worse, perhaps, to say goodbye And listen to each other's pain, Send helpless love across the sky, Knowing we'll never meet again, Or jump together, hand in hand, To certain death. Spared all of this For now, how well I understand That love is all, is all there is.
